result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael S Forneste

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Michael S Forneste not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Michael S Forneste.  Prosecuting attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel requests a status conference date, so case can track along with pending felony matter. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 8-29-22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 8-1-22

Defendant Michael S Forneste in court with Attorney Jason A Findling.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-30-22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 6-21-22
Received and Filed:  Attorney Jason Findling

Defendant Michael S Forneste not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff
06/17/2022
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AA, JA, 6100 block S Barland Ave

Defendant Michael S Forneste in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Michael S Forneste in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael S Forneste appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
